search_engine

Class Indexer

  • java.lang.Object
    • search_engine.indexer.Indexer

  • public class Indexer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provide index service to index a single document to the database of the search engine.
    Indexer accepts documents as a single file or a list of lines from its Instantiator.

    Note:
    1. This class need to explicitly trigger by called start() method after instantiated to begin indexing

    For example: 
     {
        @code
        Indexer indexer = new Indexer(docName, document);
        indexer.start();
 }

    2. As this class may take a very long time to finish indexing one document, and 2 Indexers cannot run concurrently, Indexer is recommended to run in a separate Thread to avoid blocking the Instantiator
    Author:
    ngtrhieu0011

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Dictionary _dictionary 
      private java.lang.String _docName 
      private DocumentList _documentList
      The document list stores all the indexed document name (in this case, url of the document)
      Each document name is stored on a separated String
      The docID of each document is the index of the String in the list
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> _indexDocument
      This private variable is use to store all the tokenized, stemmed words in the original document sent to the Indexer
      private PostingList _localPosting

        private DocumentList _documentList
        The document list stores all the indexed document name (in this case, url of the document)
        Each document name is stored on a separated String
        The docID of each document is the index of the String in the list

    • Constructor Detail

      • Indexer

        public Indexer(java.lang.String docName,
       java.lang.String fileName)
        throws java.io.IOException
        Standard Constructor.
        Pass the document to the Indexer as a file.
        The indexer should only be noticed when the file is ready to use.
        Parameters:
        docName - specifies the name of the document. In the search engine, this should be the link to the website.
        fileName - specifies the name of the file storing the document. This file should be able to open by the Indexer.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when the file cannot be opened or some IO errors happened when reading the file

      • Indexer

        public Indexer(java.lang.String docName,
       java.util.List<java.lang.String> document)
        Recommended Constructor
        This constructor is safer to use, thus recommended.
        Pass the document to the Indexer as a List of String.
        Parameters:
        docName - specifies the name of the document. In the search engine, this should be the link to the website.
        document - the List of String, each String represents a line in the document.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Start method
        This method must be explicitly triggered in order for the Indexer to start indexing documents
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when IO error occurs

      • indexDocument

        private void indexDocument()
        index the _indexDocument into _documentList, _dictionary and _postings
